review_title: Best Practice I have ever worked for.
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Open, kind, professional, supportive staff Opportunities to grow. Flexible scheduling Balanced Staffing ratios. A real chance to make a difference.
cons: Cerner EMR creates frustration and barriers to quality care for the good providers at times.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Jefferson City, MO
pros: CRMC has a family atmosphere . There is a collegial feel and I like working with DO's although there are also MD's
cons: poor planning. poor insight into keeping staff, poor appreciation for longevity, gas lighting managers they don't want to stay

job_title: Medical Assistant in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Can get in with good groups of coworkers Small family type workplace atmosphere Ted Brandt- He was on the board, makes us all feel like we belonged and were noticed/heard. He always made us feel noticed for our hard work.
cons: -Disorganized -Underpaid- unbiased and incompetent raises/pay. There is no rhyme or reason to the pay even after asked for the “formula” it didn’t add up. Which leads me to think they really don’t have a clue. -Small family type workplace atmosphere- this is also a con. When your a target you won’t last much longer. -food is way over priced - They got rid of Ted Brandt due to budget cuts.. BIG mistake.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Closest to home for my profession
cons: Lack of support for staff Poor staffing Loyalty to company is not appreciated Managers have their favorites Not all the expectations for job are the same for everyone in the same job with the same job longevity Pay is not based on performance, loyalty or experience

job_title: Clinic Licensed Practical Nurse in Jefferson City, MO
pros: If you have their insurance you get 50% off your hospital bill.
cons: Lack of competing pay, they have no scale to negotiate your pay

job_title: Practice Manager in Jefferson City, MO
pros: I didn’t have to commute far to work
cons: Upper management is horrible, a lot of favoritism, they will say one thing but do the opposite, commonly tell you what you want to hear but don’t follow through.

job_title: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN) in Fresno, CA
pros: Experience, pay, coworkers, and manager
cons: Schedule, staffing, stress, and coworkers

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Close to home for me
cons:
Poor pay
Poor benefits
Poor management

job_title: Certified Occupational Therapist Assistant (COTA) in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Only positive is proximity if you live in the area.
cons: Horrible management, horrible pay, vacations never approved, yet managers are away on week-long vacations all the time. Disrespectful, incompetent management from top to bottom. Prepare to be infantilized and insulted. They thrive on short-staffing all departments and then crying about overtime and productivity rates. Would never recommend this hospital.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Jefferson City, MO
pros: The patients are great, caring and appreciative
cons:
Management 
Low pay
Disrespect
Hospital is broke so bonus’ get taken back
Old technology 
Terrible system

job_title: Data Analyst in Jefferson City, MO
pros: flexible, hours, people, benefits, work
cons: Pay, mainly just the pay was low

job_title: Medical Records Technician in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Variety of tasks, never became boring.
cons: Environment can become pretty toxic, a lot like high school.

job_title: Registration Clerk in Jefferson City, MO
pros: The organization likes to try and work as a group and one big family
cons: The pay is not good and there seems to be a lot of issues with superiors

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Jefferson City, MO
pros: There really aren’t any to be honest.
cons: Low pay, absurd patient loads, absent minded management.

job_title: Manager, Respiratory Therapy Department in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Atmosphere, Employees, Environment, Work Ethic
cons: There aren't any major cons that I can pinpoint

review_title: Great culture goes a long way
job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Great culture, and feel appreciated
cons: Low Pay, Low staff in several areas

job_title: Supervisor in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Administration is amazing. Proven time after time that they have the staff and community's best interest at heart. Navigated a recession, tornado and the pandemic with confidence and skill.
cons: Nothing that I can think of at this time.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Jefferson City, MO
pros:
Annual Raises
Good Benefits
Small, community environment
cons:
Lacking psychological services
High burnout
Glorified mediocrity

job_title: Other/Not Applicable in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Great co-workers and friendly hospital staff.
cons: Bit lower pay than local competitors.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Jefferson City, MO
pros: I've been with the hospital for over 15 years and enjoy the staff, although it seems like there are more and more new faces every day and that they are not retaining old employees
cons: Don't expect to retain staff if you are paying someone with less years and experience more than someone who has been there for years. New graduates come in making what a 10 year nurse is making or more. Don't value dedication and hard work.

job_title: Clinical Nurse in Freeburg, MO
pros: Friendly staff, great physicians to work with. Great sense of belonging and pride in my work here.  So many good resources and educators to help with issues.
cons: HR Dept. is horrible to get in contact with.  If you don't know someone on the inside, you will likely have trouble getting a phone call after applying.

job_title: EVS Worker in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Decent health insurance and benefits. Day shift housekeepers are nice and some of the best people to work with.
cons: Over worked because housekeeping is constantly short staffed. Most of the Patient Care Techs  don't like to help when they can clearly see housekeeping is busy and they will sit at the nusre's stations and play on their phones.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Awesome place to work with great employee morale, monthly celebrations for employees.  Great support from upper management.  Lots of opportunity for advancement.  Innovative technology of tomorrow available today.  DaVinci Robot for surgeries, and also the only Stroke and STEMI center in the area. Awesome Community involvement.
cons: No job is 100% perfect but cannot think of any true Cons

review_title: Excellent Hospital-I loved my job as a Medical Records Technician
job_title: Medical Records Technician in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Good benefits, good working conditions, staff that truly cared about patients and their families.
cons: Poor management in my department.  Often set up people to fail, including myself, if she couldn't manipulate you.

review_title: Capital Region is an excellent employer.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Its like a family working for a community hospital. The wages are competitive. The equipment is up to date and up and coming.
cons: I cant think of anything at this time that I dont like about the facility or management. My experience has been a good one.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Jacksonville, FL
pros: flexible, good work-life balance, school is encouraged, diversity still exist even though it is not encouraged,
cons: racist, unhealthy  competition encouraged, high turn over rate, management incompetence, negative work environment

review_title: Progressive organization focused on improving the patient experience.

cons: As like all other healthcare organizations, fiscal challenges are a con.
